title: France manager Didier Deschamps hints at international recall for exiled striker Karim Benzema
text:
Sport France manager Didier Deschamps hints at international recall for exiled striker Karim Benzema Benzema hasn't played for France in 16 months but Deschamps has offered him hope that he could soon return to the fold Share Karim Benzema has been thrown an international lifeline by France boss Didier Deschamps (Photo: Getty) Share Get football   
Didier Deschamps has opened the door for exiled striker Karim Benzema to return to the France squad. 
The Real Madrid forward hasn't played for his country since October 2015 due to his alleged role in a sex-tape blackmail plot against fellow French footballer Mathieu Valbuena. 
Benzema remains under investigation by French authorities but that won't deter Deschamps from selecting the 29-year-old if he believes the striker's club form warrants a call-up. 
"What happened is in the past now. I do not feel any resentment toward him," Deschamps told Le Parisien. Read More Benzema is under investigation by authorities for his alleged role in a blackmail plot against fellow Frenchman Mathieu Valbuena (Photo: Reuters) Deschamps has opened the door for Benzema to return to France's international set-up (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
"Other players have made inappropriate statements toward me and that never stopped me from calling them up. An invitation to the national team is not a declaration of love. 
"If I think it is good for the team to recall Karim, then I will recall him. I only make my decisions based on sporting reasons. I always ask myself if a decision is in the team's best interest. 
"Karim is still one of the best attackers France have. Nothing is impossible. Lassana Diarra did not play for France for five years and then returned. Nobody knows what will happen in the future." poll loading Will Karim Benzema ever play for France again? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
